values.description: Unmanned aerial system operated via real-time video transmission, providing the pilot with an immersive first-person perspective. Commonly used for precision strike, reconnaissance, or high-maneuverability missions.
Unmanned aerial system capable of vertical take-off and landing without requiring a runway, enabling deployment in constrained or austere environments.
Unmanned aerial system designed to loiter over an area before engaging a target through self-detonation, combining surveillance and strike capabilities in a single platform.
Unmanned aerial system configured to conduct intelligence gathering, persistent surveillance, and reconnaissance missions using optical, infrared, or electronic sensors.
Multirotor unmanned aerial system featuring four rotors, offering high maneuverability, vertical lift capability, and suitability for short-range tactical missions.
Multirotor unmanned aerial system equipped with eight rotors, providing increased lift capacity, redundancy, and improved payload capability compared to smaller multirotor platforms.

values.expanded: Drone may be remotely controlled by fiber optic link
values.description: Unmanned aerial system capable of command and control via a fiber-optic tether, reducing vulnerability to radio-frequency jamming and electronic warfare interference.

values.expanded: Drone designed to do in flight interception
values.description: Unmanned aerial system specifically engineered to intercept and neutralize other aerial platforms during flight, typically used in counter-UAS roles.
Unmanned aerial system utilizing a rotary-wing helicopter configuration, enabling hovering capability and extended endurance compared to multirotor systems.
Multirotor unmanned aerial system with six rotors, balancing maneuverability, payload capacity, and redundancy for tactical and operational missions.
Unmanned aerial system employing a flying wing aerodynamic configuration, optimizing lift-to-drag ratio, endurance, and reduced radar cross-section.
Loitering munition system intended for coordinated or saturation attacks, capable of persistent presence over a target area before terminal engagement.
Unmanned aerial system configured for the transport and delivery of logistical payloads, supplies, or equipment to forward or remote positions.

Unmanned aerial system that utilize GNSS and/or inertial navigation to fly to specific, pre-programmed geographical coordinates. They generally do not possess the ability to loiter, hunt for moving targets or return to base if a target is not found.
